name: src/native/IOSTransitions.js
content:
/**
 * IOS Transtion Options
 * @ignore
 */
module.exports = {
  UIViewAnimationOptionLayoutSubviews: 1 << 0,
  UIViewAnimationOptionAllowUserInteraction: 1 << 1,
  UIViewAnimationOptionBeginFromCurrentState: 1 << 2,
  UIViewAnimationOptionRepeat: 1 << 3,
  UIViewAnimationOptionAutoreverse: 1 << 4, // Run the animation backwards and forwards (must be combined with the repeat option).
  UIViewAnimationOptionOverrideInheritedDuration: 1 << 5, //Force the animation to use the original duration value specified when the animation was submitted.
  UIViewAnimationOptionOverrideInheritedCurve: 1 << 6, //Force the animation to use the original curve value specified when the animation was submitted.
  UIViewAnimationOptionAllowAnimatedContent: 1 << 7, //Animate the views by changing the property values dynamically and redrawing the view.
  UIViewAnimationOptionShowHideTransitionViews: 1 << 8, // Hide or show views during a view transition.
  UIViewAnimationOptionOverrideInheritedOptions: 1 << 9, // The option to not inherit the animation type or any options.
  UIViewAnimationOptionCurveEaseInOut: 0 << 16,
  UIViewAnimationOptionCurveEaseIn: 1 << 16,
  UIViewAnimationOptionCurveEaseOut: 2 << 16,
  UIViewAnimationOptionCurveLinear: 3 << 16,
  UIViewAnimationOptionTransitionNone: 0 << 20,
  UIViewAnimationOptionTransitionFlipFromLeft: 1 << 20,
  UIViewAnimationOptionTransitionFlipFromRight: 2 << 20,
  UIViewAnimationOptionTransitionCurlUp: 3 << 20,
  UIViewAnimationOptionTransitionCurlDown: 4 << 20,
  UIViewAnimationOptionTransitionCrossDissolve: 5 << 20,
  UIViewAnimationOptionTransitionFlipFromTop: 6 << 20,
  UIViewAnimationOptionTransitionFlipFromBottom: 7 << 20,
  UIViewAnimationOptionPreferredFramesPerSecondDefault: 0 << 24,
  UIViewAnimationOptionPreferredFramesPerSecond30: 7 << 24,
  UIViewAnimationOptionPreferredFramesPerSecond60: 3 << 24
};

Add child from root page

Push child from root NavigationController.

Only use if root conttroller is a Page instance

properties.name: isExact
properties.description: if Requested path is an exact match or not.

properties.name: params
properties.description: Request params like id or name is represented by '/path/:id' or '/path2/:name'

properties.name: exact
properties.description: Points that a route match must be exact or not. If a route is exact then it's chld routes cannot be received.

properties.name: sensitive
properties.description: If path matching is case-sensitive or not.

properties.name: modal
properties.description: If route is displayed as modal or not.

properties.name: routeShouldMatch
properties.description: Handles if route is mathed as request url

properties.name: rawQuery
properties.description: String version of the request's query-string

properties.name: active
properties.description: If Route is currently displayed or not.

properties.name: hash
properties.description: Request's url hash comes after '#' char. For example '/path/to#a-hash'

properties.name: routingState
properties.description: Keeps user data when route runs

name: RoutePath
description:
Route's path ValueObject
For internal use

description: Factory method to create a new instance

name: getPath
description: Returns route path

name: isRoot
description: Returns route is root or not.

name: toObject
description: Return quick representaion of the route-path

name: hasPath
description: Return path is empty or not

name: Route
description: Route implementation

name: of
description: Static helper method to create a new instance of Route

name: setState
description: Merges specified state to current route state

name: getState
description: Returns Route's current state

name: toJSON
description: Simple Object representation of the route

name: toString
description: String representation of the route

name: routePath
description: Helper method to return excat path of the component

name: getRedirectto
description: Returns redirection path

name: build
description:
Builds a route's view.
This method is called whenever router is routing into that path.
There are some exceptions:
- going into a tab, which the tab is created before
- for iOS, goingBack via gesture or headerBar back

params.name: router
params.description: Not the root router, the router which the route belongs to.

return.description: view = null - If the route has been built once, the previous view (page) is given. Otherwise it is null. If view is not null, returning the view back makes it singleton.

name: routeShouldMatch
description:
Triggered before when an exact match happends.
If the routeShouldMatch eventhandler is set
and routeShouldMatch returns 'true' then match happends
or routeShouldMatch returns 'false' then match is blocked

name: routeDidEnter
description: Handles route is matched and displayed

name: routeDidExit
description: Handles that route is removed by router

name: hasPath
description: If Route has a path or not

name: matchPath
description: Checks if the specified url match to the route path

name: getUrlPath
description: Returns route path as string

name: getPath
description: Clones route's path and returns

name: clone
description: Clones new instance of the route

name: Router

unknown.tagValue:
Router implementation creates a thin layer between view and application layers
to handle view changes and to create loosely coupled and resuable routing logic.

description: Factory method to create a new Router instance

name: initialize
description: Router is initialized by parent

params.name: pushHomes
params.description: It uses in order to push routers' home-route

name: __is_router
description: Fast router's instance checking

name: getCurrentUrl
description: Return current active url

name: canGoBack
description: it tests that Whether router can go back as n
examples:
...
router.canGoBack(-3) ? router.goBackto(-3) : // if not, do anything else

params.name: n
params.description:
Amount of back as negative value
return {boolean}

name: listen
description: Adds eventlisteners to listen history changes

name: addRouteBlocker
description:
Adds route block handler to history. When history is changed in anywhere
then the handler intercepts before history is changed.

name: onHistoryChange
description:
Handles history changes. Just Root router,
because routing flow mmust be always root to children,
in order to change display logic all the time.

params.name: target
params.description: Target Router which pushed to its router.

name: routeRollback
description: Removes last entry from history without trigger history is changed.

name: renderMatches
description: Renders route matches by requested path

params.name: matches
params.description: Route matches of the current request

params.name: target
params.description: Target Router which pushed to its router.

params.name: fromRouter
params.description: If the specified request if from the router or an another source.

name: routeWillEnter
description: Handles a new route which is activated in the router

name: routerDidEnter
description: Life-cycle handler emits when Router is activated

name: setasActiveRouter
description: Sets the router statically as active router

name: routerDidExit
description: Emits when the router is deactivated.

name: redirectRoute
description: Redirects route and removes last route's record from the history.

name: routeDidMatch
description: Route matched to requested url

name: renderRoute
description: Render route

name: pushRoute
description: Helper method that pushes the route's url to history

name: push
description: Pushes new history entry with specified path

params.name: path
params.description: Path or matches of the route

name: replace
description: Replaces specified path's state

name: goBack
description: Rewinds the history

params.name: url
params.description: This is an experimental feature. If you use this feature you should use for same StackRouter stack.

name: getLocation
description: Returns last location of history

name: getHistoryasArray
description: Returns History entries as Array

name: goForward
description: Forwards history

name: go
description: Changes route by history index.

name: add
description: Adds new route

name: map
description: Iterates child routes

name: dispose
description: Unloads the router

name: src/router/routeStore.js
src/types.js
content:
/**
 * @external {Page} http://docs.smartface.io/#!/api/UI.Page
 */

/**
 * @external {NavigationController} http://docs.smartface.io/#!/api/UI.NavigationController
 */

/**
 * @external {BottomTabbarController} http://docs.smartface.io/#!/api/UI.BottomTabBarController
 */

/**
 * @external {TabBarItem} http://docs.smartface.io/#!/api/UI.TabBarItem
 */

/**
 * @external {Image} http://docs.smartface.io/#!/api/UI.Image
 */

/**
 * @external {Color} http://docs.smartface.io/#!/api/UI.Color
 */

/**
 * @typedef {function(route: Route, nextState: RouteState)} RouteShouldMatchHandler
 */

/**
 * @typedef {function(route: Route, nextState: RouteState)} RouteBuildHandler
 */

/**
 * @typedef {function(path: string, routeData: object, action: string, okFn: function)} RouterBlockHandler
 *
 */

/**
 * @typedef {function(location: RouteLocation, action: string)} HistoryListener
 */
/**
 * History implementation
 *
 * @typedef {object} History
 *
 * @property {number} length Length of the history stack
 * @property {string} action Last action
 * @property {number} index Current active index of the history
 * @property {Array<RouteLocation>} entries
 * @property {function} createHref Creates an appropriate url given data
 * @property {function(path: string, data: object)} push Pushes a new entry
 * @property {function(path: string, data: object)} replace Replaces specified history entry with a desired one
 * @property {function} rollback Rollback last entry
 * @property {function(index: number)} go Jumps to desired history entry by index
 * @property {function} clear Clears all history
 * @property {function} goBack Jumps to previous entry
 * @property {function} goForward Jumps to next entry
 * @property {function(index: number):boolean} canGo Checks if history goes back or not
 * @property {function(fn: RouterBlockHandler):function} block Blocks history changes to ask user or run an another process then resume or break it.
 * @property {function(fn: HistoryListener):function} listen Adds event-handlers to listen history changes.
 *
 */

types: function(path: string, routeData: object, action: string, okFn: function)
type.name: RouterBlockHandler

name: History
description: History implementation

properties.name: index
properties.description: Current active index of the history

properties.name: createHref
properties.description: Creates an appropriate url given data

properties.name: replace
properties.description: Replaces specified history entry with a desired one

properties.name: go
properties.description: Jumps to desired history entry by index

properties.name: canGo
properties.description: Checks if history goes back or not

properties.name: block
properties.description: Blocks history changes to ask user or run an another process then resume or break it.

properties.name: listen
properties.description: Adds event-handlers to listen history changes.
